availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Deering (Scott County, Kentucky, Oldham County, Kentucky. )

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Seriah Deering and Martha Deering. Resident of Scott County in 1850. Resident of Oldham County in 1860. Served in the Oldham County State Guard (U.S.A.) as a private from September 17, 1862 to November 20, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 448A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 839.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 856.
"James Deering (Dec 1848-Aug 1920)," Find A Grave, Memorial 87198252, accessed May 8, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87198252.
